description:
'''41''' (commonly pronounced as '''''"four-one"''''') is an American [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] group founded in 2022 in [[Brooklyn]]. It consists of rappers Kyle Richh, Jenn Carter, and TaTa, who first began recording music together on [[BandLab]] during the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].

In 2022, 41 signed to [[Republic Records]] and released the controversial single "Notti Bop", a [[diss track]] against rapper [[Notti Osama]] after he was fatally stabbed at 14 years old, which went viral on [[TikTok]] and [[YouTube]] for its associated dance trend parodying his stabbing. Their 2023 single "[[Bent (41 song)|Bent]]", released as the lead single from their debut [[extended play]], ''41 World: Not the Album'' (2023), became their most successful song and charted on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Bubbling Under Hot 100]] chart.
